result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Dennis Martin Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
To be determined within 30 days.
$500.00 bond applied and balance of $5641.77 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF453.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF453.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF453.

-Apply for Drug Court, if accepted complete successfully. If not accepted complete AODA and follow through.
-Restorative Justice Program, Kris Miner will pick the program. Victims will consider attending but don't have to.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Chad or Angie Chandler, their family or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment. If not accepted into Drug Court.

timeConds.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman January 11, 2016 -
I/S 60 days condition time with 20 days credit as long as the Defendant completes the following:

1. Continue with MRT.
2. Remain employed.
3. NO CONTACT with Ms. Barton or her residence.
4. Compliance with AODA Plan.
5. Remain in compliance with rules of Probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: $5641.77 restitution to be collected from prison wages and any balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.

***AMENDED***
Per Judge R. Michael Waterman February 27, 2017 - Defendant may have contact with K. Barron for child exchange or child care purposes.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Mr. Chandler or his family.
-Defendant to undergo Anger Management.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

$268.00 to be taken from prison wages and any balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be taken from prison wages and any balance to be collected through DOC as a condition of extended supervision.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared from jail. Probation Agent Emily Anderson present.  Case called at 3:06 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a sentencing hearing on revocation. Both parties received a copy of the revocation and warrant. Atty Harrelson states there has been amended revocation packet filed. Credit for additional 39 days.  State has complied with victims rights. Victim is present today. ADA McKinley makes statement and sentencing arguments. Victim makes statement. Atty Harrelson makes statement and sentencing argument. DE makes statement. PL Exhibit #1(photos). 20 days to file appeal. 

Court orders: 

 3 1/2 years total confinement. 

- 1 1/2 years IC. 2 years ES. 219 days credit.

- Payment of restitution

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mr. Chandler and his family.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

-  Anger management

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, The Barron Family .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-  DNA Sample

-  Eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challege Incarceration Program
filed by DOC, dated 6/30/16. sf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared from jail. Case called at 10:49 a.m. Court notes this matter was set based on letter filed by Probation Agent Emily Anderson requesting balance of conditional jail time be lifted. ADA Hartung gives update on DE's progress in MRT and in agreement to conditional jail time but amended bond to no abusive contact with victim. Atty Gherty makes statement regarding victim. Gives recommendation. Atty Gherty requesting bond in 15CM720 be amended to no abusive contact with victim. Court will amend bond in 15CM72.

Court orders:

- Lift stay of the conditional jail time of 60 days. Jail credit of 42 days. Huber granted

- As a condition of probation,   It is hereby ordered, as a condition in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Barron .  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Francis Collins   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared. Chad Chandler appears via phone.  Case called at 4:10 p.m. Court notes that restitution was referred to the court commissioner on 06-15-2015. Report was issued on 06-24-15. Judgment was signed on that date and ordered restitution in the amount of $6,141.77. ADA Collins objected to a portion of that finding and set for hearing for today. ADA Collins makes argument on the lost wages and mileage in the amount of $10,580.13. Requesting court to accept judgment but review the lost wages and mileage. Atty Gherty makes argument. Does not know anything in the statute regarding de novo hearing on this matter. Asking the court to affirm the judgment. ADA Collins references Exhibit #2 that was reviewed at the fact finding hearing. Arguing the hearsay. Atty Gherty references Paragraph 3. Court needs to make a decision 1 if de novo can be done on this type of case. Recites the statute. There is nothing to review. The court commissioner submitted the findings to the court and the court made the decision on the restitution and made the order. The court is going to deny the request to a 2nd hearing regarding evidence. Court is satisfied that the order should stand. Today the court affirms the order.
Filed by ADA Collins. Requesting to have victim appear via telephone. km
from K. Kitzberger Drug Court Coordinator. gme

CO: Timothy Heckmann, Reporter:  Tape,  Clerk: Benoy   8:49   ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared.   Statements by Atty Collins.  Atty Gherty notes that $500 was posted and available to be paid to victim.  State calls Anglea C. Witness sworn.  Atty Collins direct.  Balance owed for medical costs is $6,139.69.  Testimony regarding medical costs & lost wages.  Exhibit #2  O/R.    Atty Gherty cross.   Witness excused.  Atty Gherty calls Michael Martin, Jr.   Witness sworn.  Atty Gherty direct.   Exhibit #1  O/R.  Testimony regarding income/expenses.  Atty Collins cross.   Court questions witness.  Witness excused.   Argument by Atty Collins.   $10,580.16 is being requested.  Argument by Atty Gherty.  Atty Gherty believes the medical to be $5,710 and requests that the victims lost wages & mileages be taken off the amount requested.   Atty Gherty is requesting a payment of $50 per month.  Atty Collins objects.   Court will order $500 bond to be released to the victim.  Court to take under advisement and submit a written recommendation to Judge Waterman.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Deiss.  Clerk: Liddle. ,ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  Mark J Gherty   DF:  Michael Dennis Martin appeared from jail. Case called at 2:44 p.m. Victim Chad Chandler appears via phone. ADA Gehler defendant filed a waiver of preliminary hearing, ADA Gehler will file information. No need for PSI. Court reviews plea questionnaire with defendant and preliminary waiver. Both parties have copies of the information filed by ADA Gehler. Victim's wife Angie Chandler present and reads statement on behalf of her husband Chad. State offers Exhibit #1(photographs). O/R. Mrs. Chandler excused at 3:04 p.m. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one Substantional Battery, def pleads NO CONTEST. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1.  ADA Gehler gives recommendations. 30 days for restitution. Atty Gherty gives statement and recommendations. 

Court Orders:
-  S/W  3 years Probation
- 39 days credit. 3 month conditional jail time. Consecutive to 13CF143. Huber allowed. 
- $268 court costs and $250.00 DNA Surcharge payable to DOC
- Restitution (to be determined in 30 days)
- Apply for Drug Court. If accepted complete successfully. If not accepted complete AODA and follow through
- Restorative Justice. Kris Miner will pick the program. Victims will consider attending but don't have to.   
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system,    on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Chad and Angie Chandler and family and residence .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Signed by HWC on 12/19/14. Fax: SCSO and Jail; cc: DA and SCSO (cert. copy).
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Kevin Gehler.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 23, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
